info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 5 at 4:17PM EDT until June 9 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Elliston.
Wildcat Creek near Lafayette.
Wabash River at Lafayette.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Newberry.
White River at Edwardsport.
.Rainfall amounts of two to four inches across central Indiana will produce minor flooding along area waterways of west-central Indiana. River flooding should begin tonight into tomorrow morning. Additional rainfall of one to two inches is possible over the White River basin through Saturday.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Edwardsport.
* WHEN...From Friday afternoon to Monday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Old Vincennes Road and State Road 358 in Daviess County and Schaefer Road in Knox County are impassable. High water affects agricultural bottomlands. During agricultural season this level is of concern to farmers on the unprotected areas along the river. High water affects river cabins.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM EDT Thursday /12:00 PM CDT Thursday/ the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 18.2 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Friday afternoon by around 215 PM EDT /115 PM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO MONDAY EVENING

area.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Gibson, IN; Knox, IN; Pike, IN
